description: Balance Scale Weight & Distance Database generated to model psychological experimental results. Each example represents a balance scale scenario with weights and distances on both sides. The task is to predict whether the scale tips left, tips right, or remains balanced based on the physics principle of torque.
creator: Generated to model experiments by Siegler, R. S. (1976), donated by Tim Hume

feature_descriptions.left-weight: Weight on the left side of the balance scale (1-5)
feature_descriptions.left-distance: Distance of left weight from the fulcrum (1-5)
feature_descriptions.right-weight: Weight on the right side of the balance scale (1-5)
feature_descriptions.right-distance: Distance of right weight from the fulcrum (1-5)

physics_rule: Class is determined by comparing (left-weight * left-distance) vs (right-weight * right-distance). If left product is greater, class is L. If right product is greater, class is R. If equal, class is B.

target_values.L: Balance scale tips to the left
target_values.R: Balance scale tips to the right

use_case: Modeling cognitive development and understanding how children learn physical principles. Used to study machine learning approaches to cognitive modeling and rule learning.
psychological_context: Based on Siegler's (1976) 'Three Aspects of Cognitive Development' study examining how children develop understanding of balance scale physics
research_applications: Used in studies of rule-based learning, cognitive modeling, parallel distributed processing, and unified theories of cognition
ethical_considerations: Synthetic dataset with no privacy concerns. Represents simplified physics model useful for educational and research purposes.
